org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.ace

Class AbstractAceContigBuilderVisitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.ace.AbstractAceContigBuilderVisitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AceContigVisitor

    public abstract class AbstractAceContigBuilderVisitor
extends Object
implements AceContigVisitor
    AbstractAceContigBuilderVisitor is an AceContigVisitor that will create a AceContigBuilder and populate it using the visit calls.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractAceContigBuilderVisitor(String contigId, int consensusLength, int numberOfReads)
      Create a new instance of AbstractAceContigBuilderVisitor that will populate an AceContigBuilder as visit methods are called.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractAceContigBuilderVisitor

        public AbstractAceContigBuilderVisitor(String contigId,
                                       int consensusLength,
                                       int numberOfReads)
        Create a new instance of AbstractAceContigBuilderVisitor that will populate an AceContigBuilder as visit methods are called.
        Parameters:
        contigId - the contig id of the contig to build.
        consensusLength - the expected initial consensus length; must be > 1.
        numberOfReads - the expected initial number of reads that will be in this builder; must be ≥ 0. This value is only used to initialize the size of internal hashes, the number of reads actually visited may be greater or less than this value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if consensusLength < 1 or numberOfReads < 0.

    • Method Detail

      • visitBasesLine

        public final void visitBasesLine(String mixedCaseBasecalls)
        Description copied from interface: AceContigVisitor
        Visit a line of basecalls of currently visited contig. A contig probably has several lines of basecalls. The characters in the bases could be mixed case. Consed differentiates high quality basecalls vs low quality basecalls by using upper and lowercase letters respectively.
        Specified by:
        visitBasesLine in interface AceContigVisitor
        Parameters:
        mixedCaseBasecalls - (some of) the basecalls of the currently visited read or consensus which might have both upper and lower case letters to denote high vs low quality.

      • visitConsensusQualities

        public void visitConsensusQualities(QualitySequence ungappedConsensusQualities)
        Ignored by default, users may override this method if they wish.

        Visit the ungapped consensus qualities of the current contig being parsed.

        Specified by:
        visitConsensusQualities in interface AceContigVisitor
        Parameters:
        ungappedConsensusQualities - all the ungapped consensus qualities as a QualitySequence; will never be null.

      • visitAlignedReadInfo

        public final void visitAlignedReadInfo(String readId,
                                       Direction dir,
                                       int gappedStartOffset)
        Description copied from interface: AceContigVisitor
        Visit a line that defines the location of a read within a contig. This is equivalent to an AF line in ace file.
        Specified by:
        visitAlignedReadInfo in interface AceContigVisitor
        Parameters:
        readId - id of read.
        dir - Direction of read inside contig.
        gappedStartOffset - gapped start position (1's based) of read inside contig.

      • visitBaseSegment

        public void visitBaseSegment(Range gappedConsensusRange,
                             String readId)
        Ignored by default, users may override this method if they wish.

        Base Segments indicate reads phrap has chosen to be the consensus at a particular position. This method will only get called if ace file contains BaseSegment data (new versions of consed no longer require it).

        Specified by:
        visitBaseSegment in interface AceContigVisitor
        Parameters:
        gappedConsensusRange - range of consensus being defined.
        readId - read id that provides coverage at that range.

      • readIgnored

        protected void readIgnored(String readId,
                           String reason)
        This method is only called if a read in this contig being visited contains invalid data so that the read can not be added to the contig builder. The most common reason why a read is ignored is the read does not contain any high quality bases that aligned to the consensus.

        By default this method does not do anything, users are encouraged to implement this method to perform some kind of logging.

        Parameters:
        readId - the read id that will be ignored by the contig builder.
        reason - the reason why the read will be ignored.

      • visitBeginRead

        public final AceContigReadVisitor visitBeginRead(String readId,
                                                 int gappedLength)
        Description copied from interface: AceContigVisitor
        Begin visiting a read. If this read should get visited, then this visitor should return a non-null instance of AceContigReadVisitor.
        Specified by:
        visitBeginRead in interface AceContigVisitor
        Parameters:
        readId - id of read being visited.
        gappedLength - gapped length of read.
        Returns:
        an AceContigReadVisitor instance which will get its visitXXX methods called for the contents of the current read, or null if this read should be skipped.

      • visitEnd

        public final void visitEnd()
        Description copied from interface: AceContigVisitor
        The current contig being visited contains no more data.
        Specified by:
        visitEnd in interface AceContigVisitor

      • visitContig

        protected abstract void visitContig(AceContigBuilder builder)
        The entire contig has been visited. This method will only be called from inside visitEnd(). Subclasses may modify the builder as they see fit.
        Parameters:
        builder - a completely populated AceContigBuilder instance containing all the contig data gathered from the visit methods; will never be null.

      • halted

        public void halted()
        By default does nothing, users may override this method to handle a halted visitor.
        Specified by:
        halted in interface AceContigVisitor
